page.title: 16Riding,Horsell Common,Woking
page.content: Where Erin rides on the Common there are many woods, most of which have pine trees. Beside the paths on the common there are lots of bushes and trees. The paths are made of mud and sometimes of stones. She belongs to a Pony Club called Samsteads. I ride at another stable on Horsell Common_ Samber Pony Stud. It is owned by Mrs Beryl Rae who lives at Shaw's Farm. There are fields for grazing, much grass and many muddy rough paths. There are lots of trees and sand and the ponies shelter under the trees. There is a white pony pen where Beryl gives lessons if it is raining and where the ponies can have a rest after having been ridden. Samber was given its name by joining the first parts of Samantha, Mrs Rae's daughter's name, and Beryl. Mrs Rae takes part in Riding for the Disabled.
